content.description: Sit start on the flat hueco as for "Soul Window", but break away after climbing out from the bulge with a long hard move out left to some good crimps. Continue climbing up and left and finish with a classic topout through the hole in the boulder! Incredible!

A fun problem that isn't quite as good as "Cayla" or "Skye Dance". Sit start on a large flat hueco. Climb more or less direct using a rib feature and some small crimps. Top out on improving patina, and grainy but good slopers.
content.location: To the left of Skye Dance beneath the large window like feature at the lip of the boulder.

content.description:
A unique and very worthy line.  Can't be missed.

Start on the two lowest slopers down in the cave and move up to the triangular undercling near the lip of the roof.  Work your way around the bulge with widely spaced crimps to the top-out.
content.location: On the north side of the 'Skye Stone', which is located farther down the trail past the 'Thunder Wall'.  It's the impressive boulder that overhangs on nearly every side.  'Skye Dance' will be on the left side of the boulder as you approach it.  Look for the funky slopers under the bulge.

content.description: A fun traverse with excellent movement. Sit start on the flat hueco as for "Soul Window" and traverse right into the giant underclings of "Skye Dance". Top out as for the previously mentioned line on decent crimps kind of high off the deck.
content.location: Starting for "Soul Window" and moving into "Skye Dance"

content.description: Sit start at good huecos and climb up to some good underclings via hard moves. Once you get to the lip of the roof, make a move out left to another undercling and then up with a huge span to a good crimp rail. Maybe for those who can't pull of "Skye Dance" or those who have already done it.

For the monsters looking for something slightly more challenging than "The Sloth" or "Golden Child". Bring lots of skin and tons of psyche for this aesthetic line.

Sit start with a small sharp left hand crimp and a slopey right hand undercling. Pull on to the wall and execute hard moves up and slightly left utilizing sharp crimps and the hueco. A big move gains jugs at the lip.
content.protection: 4 pads and a spotter. Bring superglue and some painkillers.
content.location: South face of the Skye Stone. From "Soul Window" walk left around the block and this is the obvious line up crimps and the large hueco.

content.description:
Sit start low in the cave and make fun steep moves to a crimpy lip encounter.

Tiff named this one after her doggy.
content.location: West face of the Skye Stone.
